text:
F: huge, white, very good retention
C: blonde, hazy.
A: malty, fruity, yeasty, peach, floral, bit of apples peels, hint of cellar, spicy.
T: strong pressure after opening but no gusher, malty, peppery, fruity, orange peels, strong carbonation, peach, yeasty, pear, full body, I also like regular achel 8 blond and this is not worse, fully enjoyed, 75cl bottle as Achelse Kluis from abbey monastery.

Une splendide triple à la robe dorée, mousse crémeuse. Nez complexe sur les fruits mûrs, les épices, le malt, une note houblonnée. Bouche à lattaque ample, riche, puissante, une bulle onctueuse et une longue finale équilibrée. Un délice.

Aroma - slightly perfumed, with a bit tarted white bread, young white wine, a lot of yeasts. Taste - dry, with some perfume, soured malt, fresh cereals/grains, dried white bread, some fermented fruits, yeasts.
Golden, hazy, fluffy big head. Bananas, perfume, Belgian yeast in the aroma. Dry, medium body with light sourness in the end.

Achelse Kluis

Look: yellow hazy with stable white head.

Aroma: dusty, spicy, estery, with spicy herbal notes.
Taste: dry with prominent spicy bitterness and light tartness.
High carbonation.
Flavour: some apricote brandy, peppers, again spicy herbs,
Bitter finish.

Good tripel.

BOTTLE 75 CL as Achelse Kluis. Hazy golden, huge white head. Bug and bold tripelesque aroma - Aroma of honey, pale stone fruit and wild herbs. Balanced taste, not too sweet and not overly dry / tart, heavy on wild aromatic herbs and quite bitter for a Tripel.
Nogal veel schuim en dus carbo. Erg kruidig. Typische tripel, niet mijn favoriet dus.
Goud helder bier met een grote witte schuim kraag. Ruikt fruitig, kruidig, beetje soppig. Smaakt kruidig, fruitig, zoet. Te veel carbo.

Troebele oranje gele kleur met een goede kraag 
Ruikt fruitig, kruiden, mout. Smaakt zoetig, fruitig, moutig.

750ml bottle at The Sovereign, thanks to iphonephan, who purchased it for the group and who left before I got there. Poured a very hazy yellow color with a small white, foamy head. Aroma was light funky notes, touch of light earthy hops. Funky barn and hay. Light sweet citrus. Alcohol is hidden pretty well. Tasty.

Tap into a wine glass showing hazy dark yellow with a lot of sparse white foam. 

The nose shows alot of barnyard funk and light malts. 

The palate is medium bodied and moderately carbonated. Lightly tart with a light malty sweetness and light flavors of orange. Light hoppy bitterness on the finish.

Not every day I get to try a trappist tripel that i havent tried - thanks iphonephan. Very well balanced. Florals and light caramel. Some coriander. Golden pour with good head and lacing. Light sweet finish. Nice stuff. Bottle at Sovereign.

From a 75 cl bottle at The Sovereign in Georgetown. Pours a hazy gold with a huge off white head. Aroma of tropical fruits. Flavors of banana and coriander. Smooth, smooth, smooth, with a slight bitter finish.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2016 Grote fles gekocht bij de brouwerij in Achel. Troebel blond bier met een flinke kraag die heel lang blijft. Aroma van gist, boerderij. Smaak is bitterzoet, boerderij, witte wijn,ergens wat zurigs.

Appearance: clear golden with firm white head.
Aroma: malt, vague hops.
Taste: nice bittersweet.
Palate: lasting body, lively carbonation.
Overall: very nice.

Kirkas, kullankeltainen olut vaahtoaa runsaasti. Vaahto on kestävää, pienikuplaista ja tiheää jättäen rusaan määrän tiivistä tiheää pitsiä. Tuoksussa belgihiivaa, hedelmää ja vehnää. Maussa vehnää ja kevyesti appelsiinimaista hedelmää. Alkoholi tulee hieman läpi. Täyteläinen suutuntuma, hiilihappoja varsin kevyesti. Ei niin raikas tai humaloitu kuin 8, mutta oikein toimiva nautiskeluolut. Edit. Lämmettyään ja hiivojen kanssa hedelmäisyys nousee yllättäen enemmän esiin ja alkoholi katoaa.
Bottle 0,75ltr: Hazy blond colored brew with an nicely dry bitter taste, with hints of mango, banana and maybe marzipan. Bought it at the source.

19/06/2016 @home - 75cl bottle from the abbey. 
Hazy orange with nice creamy, rocky head. Nice lively carbonation. Nose is sweet malts, fruity hops, candi sugar. Taste is sweet malty, bitter hops with fruitiness (especially peach), candi sugar and a little sour thing. Love this

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2016 Trade with BenBreeg. In Teku glass. Reading CSHTP6 Ch20 + playing Tomb Raider 2015. Foamy but doesnt affect feeling. Dry, with some sweetness and a remarkable herbal hoppyness. Improves as it warms up.

Perfect murky blond pour, long lasting dense head, gentle carbonation. A: very nicely balanced and refreshing aroma of lime, malts, pine note, yeasty saison note. Perfectly (dry) hopped, lovely. T: starts malty but fresh, hay note. Light boozy hairspray note, alcohol not as well hidden as the normal Achel Blond. Medium bitter development with peppery notes, lime, faintest marzipan note. Finish is fairly dry, fruity, banana.

very hazy yellow colour, huge, though not too dense white head; aroma of fruits like peach and grape, wine cellar, some earthy notes, some grains and floral notes; well bllanced bittersweet taste with grape and white wine notes, some candy sugar, grains, minimal alcohol and hints of peppery notes;excellent trappist beer, Im fully amazed!

Licht wazig perzik/gouden bier met flinke witte schuimkraag.
Gist in de neus met fruitige toetsen.
Goed mondgevoel met biiterige smaak.
Licht zoetige afdronk met droge nasmaak.
Misschien gedry-hopped?
Pours dark brown with light beige head. Aroma is Fruit, yeast and hops. Flavour is medium bitter, medium sweet, fruity and yeasty.
Hazy golden color with white foam. Fruity aroma. Malt, Belgian yeast. Taste is slightly sweet, caramel, fruity and silky.

75cl bottle shared with the crusty crew. Hazy dark golden with white head. Orange up front, fresh apricots, yeast, light doughy, herbs, sugary with soft caramel and fudge. Quite nice fruity sweetness with soft bitter finish. Above medium bodied with full carbonation. Very nice beer.
Great fresh aroma little malt and very fruitful looks yellow little trouble taste fruit hops some bitterness medium body a Nice beer

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2016 The last of the current Achel trappists I hadnt tasted yet, apparently only sold at the abbey in 75 cl bottles and the follow-up to Achelse Zomer, a wonderful brew I bought in 2004, which was a one-off made for the abbotts birthday; this version is slightly different, more dry and stronger. Since I remember Achelse Zomer quite well despite it being eleven years, I am very interested in how this one relates to its predecessor. Big, towering, foamy, frothy, off-white, dense, lacing head (even very slight gushing), colour hazy golden blonde with a peachy hue and fierce, champagne-like fizz; turns a murky brownish peach with deposit. Strong Belgian yeast aroma of Conférence pear, green plum, hint of banana, fresh pineapple, white bread, dough, vague suggestion of crushed peppermint leaves, whisky, roasted pine nuts, soap, subtle honey accent, flowers, but some wet paper as well, bit phenolic. Powerful onset of unripe fruits, green plum, pear, some green banana and berries, citric freshness (a little bit sourish), with a very strong, minerally, drying carbonation tantalising the tongue - for a tripel, after all a well-carbonated style in most cases, this seems even a bit overcarbonated. Lovely bready and eventually even honeyish malt sweetness ensues, perhaps some white candi syrup sweetness too, very light toasted touch to it, while the spicy yeastiness persists, becoming clove- or even slightly mint-like in the end; full but smooth mouthfeel. Finishes in nicely lingering bready malt sweetness and estery fruitiness, along with a fair dosis of leafy, lightly peppery hop bitterness, retronasal soapy phenols and warming but nowhere disturbing, jenever- or even lightly whisky-like booze. In all: more than decent, the trappist quality stamp is all over it, but it seems to lack some personality in comparison with e.g. Westmalle Tripel or Chimay Triple. Hoppier and more warming than the regular Achel 8 Blond, but a bit more coarse as well due to the high carbonation; in comparison with the original Achelse Zomer of 2004, this is a bit of a disappointment, as it lacks the lush, baroque fruit exuberance which gave Achelse Zomer its distinctive character. Still, the dry-hopping worked well here, this is a good tripel by all means.
Golden with off white head. Yeasty, herbal aroma. Flavor is similar; spicy, grassy and herbal. Some bitterness, light but sweet clean malty flavor through the finish. Very tasty.

Bottled (backlog). Hazy yellowish orange colour with a small white head. Aroma is wood, some herbs, yeast, quite citrusy as well as mild earthiness. Flavour is citrus, some wood, resin, quite strong on the yeast along with some herbs and earth to it. Yet very fresh and nice. Hides the alcohol really well.

75cl bottle shared at home. Somewhat hazy golden with a full white head. Full body with low to moderate carbonation. Well balanced sweet and bitter tones. Citrus, peach, yeast, warming alcohol and herbs. A very tasty trapist.

Beautiful golden color. Little cloudy. Nice layer of foam. Fresh smell. Taste is bitter in the end, but sweet at first. Beautifully balanced, nice craftsmanship of the monks. God, do I love Trappist beer.

Bottle at S&G tasting.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: wheat, alcohol.
TASTE: wheat, alchol, nice!
750cc bottle. Pour dark cloudy blonde with a thick white head. Sweet, fruits and flowers. Slightly dry and bitter finish.

Tasting blind from a 75cl bottle.
In the aroma alcohol, flowers (hyacinths), citrus.
The unclear yellow beer has a large white head.
A nice balanced bitter/sweet beer.
Medium carbonated.

APPEARANCE - Clear amber with 2-finger head that lasts. Good lacing.

AROMA/SCENT - Hops, grain, sweet.

TASTE - Hops, nutty, bread. ABV mostly hidden.

MOUTHFEEL/PALATE/TEXTURE - Good carbonation, clean, light, effervescent, crisp, refreshing.

VALUE - $10 for an 11 oz. bottle - not that bad for an import at a restaurant.

OVERALL/DRINKABILITY - Quite drimkable for a Tripel. Not a sipping beer.
best before date 08/2014 at home, golden beer with no head, aroma is fruit and alchol, taste is the same some bitterness, i think this one was just too bad, drainpour will try again soon
bottle sample, poured a cloudy blonde colour with a white head, belgian yeast, malts, dry aftertaste, citrus, grains, orange, some hop bitterness in the finish
Pours a deep, cloudy golden colour with a dense head. Floral aroma. Initial mouthfeel is somewhat "spritzig" and sharp but quickly gives way to a pleasantly warming flavour. Good.
Mistig gouden kleur, witte kraag. Aroma van citrusfruit, gist en alcohol. Smaak sinaasappel, gist, alcohol. Lekker en verwarmend.

Bottle @ MaartenRF10. Thanks for sharing Maarten! Clear golden color, huge soapy off-white head. Smell and taste lightly malts, yeast, some fruityness, a touch of herbs or spices, some alcohol. A bit thin texture, average body, medium carbonation. Decent as always with trappist beers.

Zomerbierfestival 14 
Pours fuzzy blonde, big white head . Smell indeed has some hops . Rather dirt/Bitter style than aromatic . 
Taste is bitter. some Belgian(ish?) hoppyness , grainy, bit sweet back . OK, typical Belgian beer . Finish is nice with some hop-aroma .
UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 Bottle 33cl. Hazy golden-amber with a small head. Aroma is sweet, oranges, citrus and malty.
75cl fles. Goudgele kleur. Witte volle schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie : kruidig, koolzuur, bittertje. Krachtig blondje :)
In fles van 75cl. Troebel geel van kleur met een matige schuimkop. Bittertje is goed te proeven naast de kruidige smaak.

75 cL bottle, poured in increments into an Achel glass. Lovely golden colour, effervescent with a foamy head. Yeasty, spiced aroma, nice dry hops. Dry, bitter aftertaste, a little yeasty. Smooth for the strength! Another tasty trappist.

Nous voici devant le paradoxe dAchel... A savoir, dans les bières brunes, on suit la progression
normale : lextra brune est supérieure à la brune. Mais pour les blondes, la blonde de 8 est vraiment
supérieure à lextra blonde que voici.
Pourtant, celle-ci présente un niveau abv de 9,5 %, et donc lespoir dune bière plus ample.
La bouteille 75 cl malheureusement nest pas bouchonnée (!!!) mais seulement capsulée	
Premier point négatif. Second point, la couleur dun doré plutôt pâle, et surtout labsence de bulles
et de mousse !!! (et pourtant mon exemplaire est à date en août 2014...).
Les arômes sont de blé, fruits blancs, fleurs daubépine, pointe de Sancerre.
1ère bouche au volume doux, souple, sur les céréales, le houblon et une herbe aromatique.
Arrière-bouche fraîche mais forte.
2ème bouche où se dirige vers les grands vins blancs secs.
3ème que je qualifierais de liqueur brassée avec une grande finesse.
Arrière-bouche très lisse.
La longueur est un modèle de suavité, avec de lampleur. Cest un peu une infusion de malts...
Quelques pointes de miel aussi.
La levure est fluide, douce, mais na pas le niveau dune grande trappiste, et certainement pas
le niveau de sa petite sur la blonde de 8.
Lalcool est bien dosé évidemment, il épanouit le breuvage.
La finale nous laisse sans trop de différence avec la longueur.... donc déçu !!
Conclusion : bière très originale, mais complètement hors référence connue...
Son apparence la pénalise, et puis il faudrait que ces moines aillent faire un tour du 
côté des chênes liège... Sa finale est vraiment faible.
Smak och doft av honung, äpple, ljus sirap, jäst. Fruktig, rund, len, oljig konsistens. Stor sötma, äppelmustaktig. Fantastisk i gommen.

Flaska från Biersgourmete.be drucken med ölföreningen. ett riktigt godisöl. Påminner om Het Ankers Keizerbleu. Men riktigt trevlig. Stor doft av söta äpplen som söt bra äppelcider, söta päron, honung, madeira, gula russin. Munkänslan är silkeslen och aningen sirapsaktig, söt stor kropp med söta fruktiga smaker. Riktigt trevlig och precis på rätt sida gränsen för att inte bli sliskig. Kräver söta tillbehör eller ost.

Bottled at the Leiderkerke Beer Festival. Clear, hoeny blonde with a tight head. Nose of honey, lemon, grass, bread. Yeasty. Sweet honey and bread flavor, with orange, and a peppery finish. Nicely bitter. Strong, mellow, balanced.

Nice golden coloured brew with a decent head that holds good. Malty and hoppy brew, with slightly some spices added, but also a less pleasant faint metallic part in the taste. A bit to hard to smell, but good to taste.

Clear golden colour, white head. Sweet aroma, raisins, malts, light madeira, fruity, light touch of hops. Sweet malty flavour, yeast, raisins, vanilla, sugar and dried fruits. Full body. Sweet malty finish, light cloying sweet, pronounced vanilla.
Great dessert beer!
(From 75cL bottle shared with a few friends. BB 6-7-13)

Bottle 750ml.Clear medium yellow orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, fruity, pale malt, light to moderate hoppy, moderate yeasty, fruity yeast. Flavour is moderate sweet and light moderate bitter with a long duration, fruity, yeasty. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft - fizzy. [20130131]

Gylden uklar skum hvid 
Humle  citrus gær blomst
Bitter lidt sød lidt 
Livlig 
@f1 loge31/1-13

Bottle shared by Thorpe429. Thanks Mike!

The beer is hazy and yellow, with a finger of white head that leaves some good lacing behind. The aroma brings some yeast, citrus, spice, malt, and subtle alcohol. Nice flavor, well balanced. Lots of citrus, slightly sweet. Yeast and spices add depth and complexity. A delicious beer. So glad to try this rare Trappist ale. Recommended.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-02-2011

Shared bottle at the 25 ste Kempisch Bierfestival, Geel. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma of sweet malts, yeast and ripe fruits. Taste is moderate sweet malty, with an easy bitter hoppy end, rather short lived.

75 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden yellow to orange with a dense off white head. Aroma is fruity and light cornish. Toasted malty, sweet caramelish and light bitter. Mild yeasty fruity. Lingering caramelish and light fruity finish.
Bottle @ Antwerps Bierhuiske. Pours cloudy golden with a small white head. Fruit, yeast and fresh hops. Smooth and full bodied. A bit sticky and warming. Phenolic fruity and fresh grassy hops. Nice.

A clear golden colored beer with a thick foamy white head. The aroma of sweet fruits like citrus with orange. There are hop notes with malts. The taste is malty fresh fruits with some light bitter hops. The aftertaste of sweet fruits with hop bitters.

Bottle, bought @ Achelse Kluis, Belgium. Pours clear golden with a firm, staying, creamy, white head. Aroma is sweet, oranges, citrus, malty, mild sweetness. Highish carbonation, fine creamy and light dry mouthfeel. Flavour is elegant, sweet, malty, vinious, lovely fruity, oranges, red apple. Lovely dry bitter finish with malty notes, apples.

Head: almost none , white 
Colour: gold/clear 
Smell: malts, sweet, little yeasty, bit of hops 
Taste: tipical sweet malty flavour of a original Abbey Tripel , but this one packs a bit more punch on the alcohol flavour , and is also a bit sweeter...

Bottle from the abbey during our recent trip to Belgium. Served in a Trappist Achel glass.

ours a clear golden-yellow with a nice white head. Light lacing and a thin collar throughout. The nose brings some clove and fairly-strong alcohol. Surprisingly (and happily) the flavor doesnt have any alcohol at all. Good clove character and light bubblegum. A bit of sweetness and mild fruit. Body is medium with good carbonation and a strong yeast presence. Good clove and spice. Overall, quite tasty and a very nice tripel.

(Bottled, 0.75l, rated 2010-09-19) Hazy golden-amber with a small, firm and lasting head. Mild, wheaty and fruity aroma with orange-peel, touch of honey and pale malt. Flavor is peachy-orangey-fruity and slightly grainy-alcoholic, with perfumy-aromatic hops, yeast, and hints of strawberry. Quite full body, warming palate, foamy CO2, rather a slow sipper than refreshing. The 8 was more Hefeweizen-like, but this is like a strong Blond-Weizenbock hybrid, with a touch of sweet Stille Nacht graininess. Not much hop bite or refreshing elements here, though, so for now I prefer the regular Blond.

75cl, new exclusive Trappist Anno 2010, from 2nd Gents Bierfestival, very complex brew, floral/sweet and slightly fruity, balanced, hazy, rocky head, very good brew

Bottle. pale golden color. Pours a huge head. Floral citric aroma with some dried tropical fruit. malty sweet, floral flavor with dried citrus and tropical fruit. A firm hopbitterness. A worthy trappist.

18/12/2010 - 75cl bottle @ Gentse Biervereniging - Trappist night
Dark blonde to orange beer, off-white rocky adhesive head. Lots of carbon in glass. Aroma: hops, alcohol, candi sugar, fruity.MF: soft carbon, full body, syrupy texture. Taste: hops, sweet malts, fruits (pears and peaches). Aftertaste: little sweet malts, hint of sugar, fruitiness, acidic touch.
